definition: Success Rate calculated as the percentage of successful UPI transactions out of total transactions. Specifically calculated as the ratio of successful transactions (with 'SUCCESS' or 'DEEMED' status) to total overall transactions (including success, deemed, failure, and pending status). The calculation is performed as the count of transactions with DEEMED or SUCCESS status divided by total transaction count. Implementation approaches include: (1) Count of transactions with status 'DEEMED' or 'SUCCESS' divided by total transaction count, or (2) Success transactions multiplied by 100 divided by overall transactions. Both approaches represent the percentage of successful UPI transactions across all transaction statuses.
Unified Payments Interface - India's instant real-time payment system that facilitates inter-bank transactions through mobile platforms, enabling instant money transfers and digital payments.

Person-to-Person transactions - UPI payments made between individual users, including VPA2ACCOUNT and VPA2VPA transaction categories. These transactions represent payments made directly between individual users through the UPI system where individuals transfer money to other individuals using VPA to VPA or VPA to Account.

Person-to-Merchant transactions - payments made from users to merchants/businesses. Specifically includes VPA2MERCHANT transaction types in UPI payment systems where individuals make payments to merchants using VPA to Merchant flow. This category encompasses all payment flows from individual users to business entities or merchants across different dashboard contexts, with particular focus on UPI payments made from individuals to merchants.

Scan and Pay transactions, including 3P QR and Paytm QR payments and flow categories. This category encompasses all Scan and Pay transaction types across different payment flows, as consistently defined across multiple dashboards.
Status classifications for UPI transactions including SUCCESS, DEEMED, and other failure statuses.
Payment Service Provider - entities that facilitate UPI transactions, categorized as Paytm or Others based on handle classification.

Classification system for UPI transactions that encompasses multiple categorization approaches: (1) Transaction types including P2P, 3P QR, Paytm QR, Intent, P2M Collect, Mandate_Online, Onus_ExcMandates, and Mandate_Onus (Dashboard 511), and (2) Transaction flows including VPA2MERCHANT, VPA2VPA, and VPA2ACCOUNT categories (Dashboard 476). This term represents different but complementary ways to classify UPI transaction patterns and processing methods.

Online transaction category for UPI transactions including Intent, P2M Collect, and Mandate_Online flow categories/flows. Used across multiple dashboards to categorize online payment transactions and flows, encompassing various online UPI transaction types and payment flows.

On-us transaction category including Onus_ExcMandates and Mandate_Onus flow categories where both payer and payee are within the same payment system or bank. These transactions occur when both parties involved are served by the same financial institution. This encompasses flows within the same bank as well as broader payment system contexts, covering both bank-level and payment system-level on-us transactions.

Transaction categorization field that classifies transactions (including UPI transactions) as either Person-to-Person (P2P) or Person-to-Merchant (P2M) based on transaction category and type classification grouping
The day of the month extracted from the transaction date, used for daily trend analysis and daily analysis of transaction patterns.

Month component extracted from transaction date using date_trunc function for monthly analysis and aggregation. This metric truncates the transaction date to the month level, enabling monthly trend analysis and reporting.
A transaction status category considered as successful for success rate calculations along with SUCCESS status

A transaction status indicating the transaction was completed successfully. Specifically refers to count of UPI transactions with status 'success' or 'deemed'. Used across dashboards to track successful transaction completions.
Classification of UPI transactions into different payment flows and types
UPI identifier handles for payer and payee, used to classify transactions by PSP (e.g., paytm, ptyes, ptaxis).
The UPI handle of the entity making the payment in a UPI transaction
Payment service provider handles including paytm, ptyes, ptaxis, pthdfc, ptsbi for payer classification
Monthly Active Users calculated as sum of users who have use_case_mtd greater than 0, indicating users who performed at least one UPI transaction use case in the current month

Count of users in the system. General definition: Total count of users representing the sum of all users across different lifecycle stages and account profiles. In SuperCash context: Count of distinct users who have SuperCash transactions in the selected time period. The specific scope may vary depending on dashboard context and filters applied.
business_alias: Total Users, Users, Unique Users, Number of Users, User Count

definition: Percentage distribution calculated as (MAU for each handle group / Total MAU within lifecycle partition) * 100, showing the proportion of monthly active users across different handle counts
business_alias: MAU Distribution Percentage, Retention Rate, Percentage Distribution

definition: Count of distinct UPI accounts/handles per user, representing the number of active UPI accounts a user maintains
User lifecycle categorization in the current month, including stages like Active, Dormant, and other user states based on transaction activity.
business_alias: User Lifecycle, Customer Lifecycle, Lifecycle Current Month

definition: Month-to-date use case activity indicator showing whether a user has performed UPI transactions in distinct use cases during the current month
business_alias: Use Cases Month-to-Date, Monthly Use Case Activity

definition: Count of distinct bank accounts associated with users, representing the number of linked payment accounts.
User lifecycle status indicating inactive users who have not performed transactions within the specified period.
Last Month To Date Monthly Active Users - sum of users filtered for the LMTD period, representing active users from the same day range in the previous month
Month To Date Monthly Active Users - sum of users filtered for the MTD period, representing active users from the beginning of current month to current date
Last Month To Date - time period representing the same day range in the previous month as the current MTD period
business_alias: Last Month Till Date, Last Month To Date

definition: Month To Date (MTD) - refers to the time period from the beginning of the current month up to the current date, representing data accumulated from the start of the current month through today. This term is used across dashboards to indicate metrics calculated from the first day of the current month up to the present date.
business_alias: Month To Date, Month to Date, Month-to-Date

definition: Different categories or types of UPI transactions and payment flows that users engage with

User classification system that categorizes users based on their engagement patterns and behavioral stages. Includes specific categories such as new users ('a:new') and reactivated users ('c:react') based on their UPI usage patterns.
business_alias: Lifecycle CM, Customer Lifecycle, User Lifecycle Stage, User Type, User Profile, User_type, user_type, Customer Lifecycle Stage

definition: Daily Active Users - the number of unique users who perform at least one UPI transaction on a given day
Total number of UPI transactions including PAY and COLLECT transaction types with SUCCESS or DEEMED status. Also used as a general count of all transactions processed.
Transactions Per User - calculated as total transactions divided by Daily Active Users (sum(txns)/sum(DAU))
Top 20 cities in India including New Delhi, Bangalore, Hyderabad, Jaipur, Mumbai, Chennai, Noida, Gurgaon, and others where UPI transactions are analyzed
The percentage of users who continue to use UPI services in subsequent months, calculated as users divided by the maximum users in the same lifecycle and base month partition
business_alias: Retention Rate, NRR_retention, User Retention Analysis, User Retention Rate

definition: The initial month when a user first becomes active, used as reference point for retention calculations
Users classified as 'a:new' in their lifecycle stage, representing first-time UPI users in a given period
The difference in months between the base month and retention month, used to measure retention periods. Calculated using date_diff function.
Count of distinct customers (scope_cust_id) within a specific lifecycle and time period
The starting month used as a reference point for calculating retention cohorts, user lifecycle analysis, and measuring user activity progression
User lifecycle category representing repeat users who have made multiple UPI transactions
Customer reactive segment that includes users with reaction patterns categorized as 'c:react 1-3' and 'c:react 3+' user types
business_alias: Reactivated Customers, reactive users, Customer Reactive

definition: Unique customer identifier used to track individual users across different time periods for retention analysis
Total count of all UPI transactions including success, deemed, failure, and pending statuses across all transaction types
Classification of UPI transaction types/flows based on transaction categories including VPA2MERCHANT (VPA to Merchant), VPA2VPA (VPA to VPA), and VPA2ACCOUNT (VPA to Account)
UPI transaction category representing Virtual Payment Address to Merchant transactions. These are UPI transactions from Virtual Payment Address to merchant accounts.
UPI transaction category representing Virtual Payment Address to Virtual Payment Address transactions (peer-to-peer transfers between Virtual Payment Addresses)
UPI transaction category representing Virtual Payment Address to Account transactions. These are UPI transactions from Virtual Payment Address to bank account.
Day over Day comparison/analysis comparing metrics between consecutive days to identify trends and changes
Month-over-month growth percentage calculated as sum of month-over-month growth divided by sum of users (SUM(mom_growth)/SUM(users))
Current month or month zero in retention analysis, indicating users in their base month of activity
Net Retention Rate - calculated as current month users divided by the maximum users in the same lifecycle and base month cohort
Total count of distinct users who were active in the last month period

Count of users who were active in both the base period and the subsequent retention period. These are users from the base period who continued to be active in the current period, used to measure user retention.

Count of distinct users from the previous month across different lifecycle stages who form the baseline for retention calculation. This represents the total count of users in the base period used for retention analysis, typically representing users active in the previous month.
Count of distinct users who were active in the previous month and also performed transactions in the current month-to-date period
The subsequent month being compared to the base month to measure user retention and for retention analysis
Classification or segmentation of users based on their UPI usage patterns and characteristics
Breakdown or allocation of MAU across different user profiles or segments
Users who have returned to using UPI services after a period of inactivity (c:react lifecycle)
Classification of users based on their engagement patterns (c:react, c:react 1-3, c:react 3+)
Analysis of user metrics segmented by different user profile characteristics or lifecycle stages
Total monetary value of transactions processed. Specifically refers to the total monetary value of all UPI transactions in the specified period and currency.
Gross Merchandise Value - total monetary value of transactions processed. Specifically refers to the total transaction amount/value processed through UPI payments.

Ratio of P2P Daily Active Users divided by P2M Daily Active Users. Implementation varies by dashboard: (1) Direct ratio calculated as sum of P2P DAU divided by sum of P2M DAU, and (2) Time-based comparison using LAG function to compare previous period DAU values.

Ratio of P2P transactions divided by P2M transactions. This metric compares P2P transaction count to P2M transaction count and can be calculated as: (1) sum of P2P transaction count divided by sum of P2M transaction count, or (2) using LAG function to compare previous period transaction values for temporal analysis.

Ratio of P2P gross merchandise value divided by P2M gross merchandise value. Calculated as sum of P2P amount divided by sum of P2M amount. Implementation may use LAG function to compare previous period GMV values for time-based analysis.
Binary classification indicating whether a user is involved in gaming transactions ('Gaming') or not ('Non_gaming')
Count of distinct transaction categories (P2P, SnP, Online, Onus) that a user has engaged in during the month
Real Money Gaming - category referring to gaming merchants and related user engagement metrics
Segmentation approach that groups users based on their behavioral patterns, lifecycle stages, or user types

Geographical state dimension representing the state where UPI users are located and transactions occur, used for analyzing UPI transaction distribution and regional analysis across different Indian states
Payment service provider identifiers including paytm, ptyes, ptaxis, pthdfc, ptsbi for transaction routing
Grouping dimension used for segmenting UPI retention analysis, likely referring to GMV Per User or similar user profiling metric.
Monthly Active Users - the count of unique users who were active within a specific month period
Percentage of users retained from previous period, calculated as (Retained users Ã— 100) / Total users
Count of unique users who viewed the PTS Banner 2.0 across different UPI features. This metric tracks users who viewed the banner for various UPI features.
Count of users who completed a conversion action (target action) after viewing the banner
Count of users who clicked on the banner for UPI features
Count of users who completed a conversion action (target action) after clicking the banner
Target Group - users who are exposed to the experimental feature or banner
Control Group - users who are not exposed to the experimental feature, used as baseline for comparison
New version of the Payment Transaction Success banner used for promoting UPI features
UPI feature that allows users to link their bank accounts to the payment platform for payments
UPI feature that allows users to link their RuPay Credit Cards to the platform for UPI payments
Feature activation for UPI Lite service, enabling small-value transactions without PIN. This service allows users to activate UPI Lite small value payment functionality.
Feature allowing users to download their UPI transaction statements
Feature for automatically topping up UPI Lite balance when it falls below threshold
business_alias: UPI Lite Auto Top-up, Lite auto top-up

definition: Total aggregated count of all users who viewed banners across all UPI features
Target Group and Control Group tracking methodology for measuring banner effectiveness
Feature allowing users to download their UPI transaction statements
Widget feature for receiving money through UPI interface
Widget feature for scanning QR codes and making UPI payments
Feature providing users with analytics and insights on their spending patterns

Total count of successful UPI transactions, including transactions with 'success' and 'deemed' status. A transaction status indicating the transaction was completed successfully. Used both as a categorical status value and as a metric for counting successful transactions across dashboards.
Total number of UPI transactions including PAY and COLLECT transaction types with SUCCESS or DEEMED status. This metric represents the total count of transactions processed across the system.
Total sum of standardized cashburn amounts aggregated over time, representing the monetary value of cashback given to users

Calculated cashback value converted to standard currency based on redemption type: coins divided by 166.67, goldcoins divided by 100, UPI amount plus 0.2478, otherwise original amount. This represents the cash equivalent value of redeemed rewards across different redemption channels.
Reward system offering cash benefits through various redemption types including coins, goldcoins, and UPI transactions
Classification of how cashback is redeemed including coins, goldcoins, and UPI methods, each with different conversion rates
Status tracking for cashback processing including Given (3), Processing (2), and Pending (1) states
Total sum of cashburn amounts across all transactions, aggregated from individual cashburn calculations
business_alias: Total Cash Burn, Cash Burn Sum, Total Cashburn, Cashburn Sum

definition: UPI SuperCash campaign identifier that groups transactions by specific promotional campaigns. Marketing campaign identifier associated with SuperCash offers and promotions, used to track and categorize promotional activities.
business_alias: Campaign Name, Promo Campaign, Campaign ID

definition: Transaction status indicating completion state of SuperCash transactions. Status values include: Given (completed), Processing (in progress), Pending (awaiting fulfillment), and Unscratched (not activated). This field tracks the current state of transactions throughout their lifecycle and represents the current state of SuperCash transactions.

Digital wallet platform, service, or payment method associated with the SuperCash campaign and transactions. Encompasses both the wallet provider/platform and the specific digital wallet type used for payments. This includes wallet platforms or services as well as the digital wallet types or payment methods used in SuperCash transactions.
Calculated cashback amount based on redemption type: coins (amount/166.67), goldcoins (amount/100), UPI (amount+0.2478), or original amount for other types
Status category for cashback that has been successfully delivered to users (status=1, fulfillment_status=3)
Status category for cashback that is currently being processed (status=1, fulfillment_status=2)
Cashback status when status=1 and fulfillment_status=1, indicating cashback is awaiting processing
Status category for scratch cards that have not been scratched by users (status=2, fulfillment_status=1)
Redemption type for cashback where amount is divided by 166.67 to calculate cash burn
Redemption type for cashback where amount is divided by 100 to calculate cash burn
Month-to-date count of unique users who performed transactions on a daily basis
Unique count of user identifiers, representing the number of distinct users
Month-to-date count of unique users who have been gratified (received benefits) through the UPI SuperCash program
Cashback program related to UPI transactions offering rewards through various redemption types including coins, goldcoins, and direct UPI transfers
Type of SuperCash redemption method including coins, goldcoins, UPI, and other payment methods
Total number/count of UPI transactions including PAY and COLLECT transaction types with SUCCESS or DEEMED status
Count of transactions with status 'success' or 'deemed' indicating completed successful payments
Total count of all transactions including success, deemed, failure, and pending status transactions
Calculated field that categorizes transactions as either P2P or P2M based on is_p2p and is_p2m boolean flags
Unique transaction identifier used to count total number of UPI transactions
UPI handle of the person or entity initiating the payment transaction
UPI handle of the person or entity receiving the payment transaction
